weapon.name: Debugging wand
weapon.description: Lets you write breakpoints in reality. When a user defined action occurs you can change its outcome or delete it from reality. Maximum of 1 active breakpoint. Cooldown of 10 ticks.
weapon.note: Why is my spell doing what I’m telling it to do and not what I want it to do?

weapon.name: Fiery sword
weapon.description: At your command the sword is engulfed in flames for 5 ticks, dealing 2 additional fire damage. Cooldown of 10 ticks.

weapon.name: Perfectly tuned harp
weapon.description:
The sound of this instrument is too in tune: anyone in a 3 hexes radius area gets 4 sound damage. Alternatively, you can play a song from the following list, as a 1 tick action.
Killer queen: deals 3 sound damage to the two closest enemies (you choose in case of ambiguity) and your allies in a 2 hexes radius get 2 additional magic damage in their next attack.
Crazy diamond: restores 5 HPs to you and 3 HPs to your allies within 2 hexes.
Bites the dust: the two closest enemies cannot move for 2 ticks and allies within 2 hexes can move 1 additional hex per tick for the same duration.
Cooldown of 10 ticks. Perfectly tuned harp counts as an instrument for a Bard. Occupy 1 slot in the backpack.

weapon.name: Elderwood Staff
weapon.description: Your damaging spells deal twice the damage. This effect does not apply to spells casted with Double trouble. You gain the ability Shool of magic: With a 1 tick action, choose a spell of yours. That spell can be casted with 1 tick less than usual (no more than 2 spells can be casted this way) until you own that spell. Only one kind of spell can be the target of this ability at a time.
weapon.note: Now don’t you get any foolish idea as magic will solve all your problems. Because it won’t!

weapon.name: My bow!
weapon.description: Lets you shoot multiple targets at once or the same target multiple times up to 5 arrows. Cooldown of 10 ticks.   Occupy 1 slot in the backpack.
weapon.note: That still only counts as one!

armour.name: Robert’s Breastplate
armour.description: The resistance of this item increases by 1 for each 15 maximum HP you have. Lose 5% AG.
armour.note: Look at this idiot, one ball and no brain!

armour.name: Very-special-Armour
armour.description: The resistance of this item is increased by 2 if you own a nothing-special item. Your AG is increased by 20% if you own at least two nothing-special items. If you own 3 or more nothing-special items, you cannot be the target of any unsolicited spell.
armour.note: Which is another way to say no other Armour is special.

armour.name: Flaming Armour
armour.description: You are immune to fire damage. Anybody that enters in contact with you takes 2 fire damage.
armour.note: A thousand years bad juju for killing fire-king!

armour.name: Superman’ suit
armour.description: Spending 1 EP, you can fly at the speed of 2 hexes per tick for the duration of 5 ticks. While you are flying you get 35% AG with Superman’ suit. You cannot wear other armour items.
armour.note: Let it be clear: you cannot revert time!

armour.name: Juggernaut’s coating
armour.description: You lose your AG. You can't perform movement abilities and you cannot wear other armour items. Your melee attacks deal 6 additional damage.

spell.name: ZA WARUDO!
spell.description: Stops time for up to 11 ticks. You can move freely and perform any actions.

spell.name: Warp Orb!
spell.description: Launch a sphere that tracks down all hostile targets. The sphere moves at the speed of 2 hexes per tick and deals 3 magic damage to each target it touches as well as stunning them for 2 ticks. It always moves towards the next nearest target.
spell.note: How many apples do you have?!

spell.name: Dracarys
spell.description: All units in a 6 hexes radius cone get 2 magic damage and 5 fire damage. They also keep burning for 3 ticks, suffering 2 fire damage each tick.
spell.note: I swear to you, that those who would harm you will die screaming.

spell.name: Hamlet
spell.description: Summon a powerful hurricane that sweeps enemies 3 hexes away making them lose their actions in this tick. If they bump into a wall, they take 3 damage and stay stunned the next tick.
spell.note: Hi Ophelia, I’m a tornado! Brawlrllrlrrlrlrl.

spell.name: Fire Wall! Fire Wall!
spell.description: A magical wall of fire of radius 3 surrounds the caster for 7 ticks. The wall deals 3 fire damage per tick to anyone standing in it. Furthermore any projectile passing through the wall directed to the caster is incinerated, however any projectile coming from inside the wall is engulfed in flames, giving it 1 additional fire damage.
spell.note: Can’t we just point it at the bad guys?

misc.name: Liquid luck
misc.description: Multiple item loot. Consume while looting to obtain a LK score of 7 and loot an additional time. If your LK is already equal to 7, you can discard any item looted you don’t like to loot again.

misc.name: Holy hand grenade
misc.description: Multiple item loot. You can throw Holy hand grenade in a tile up to 5 hexes away with a 1 tick action. You secretly decide a number between 1 and 5. The radius of the hexplosion increases with the number of ticks selected up to 4. The damage falls off as 11 holy damage / distance rounded up.

misc.name: Muffin’s factory deed of ownership
misc.description: You own a muffin’s factory. With a 2 ticks atomic action you can offer to minions in a 4 hexes area a blue collar job in your factory: for each minion there is a 40% chance they accept the next tick and go to work in your factory. Each worker produces 1 Muffin every 5 ticks. Cooldown of 10 ticks.
misc.note: Let me lend you an invisible hand.

misc.name: Evil Villainy Inc. majority shares
misc.description: You’ve acquired the property of EV Inc. Congratulations! You can switch places with the tower master.
misc.note: Oh, you are a villain, alright… just not a super one.

misc.name: Portable portals
misc.description:
This machine gives you the ability Sorry about the mess: With a 1 tick action, you secretly choose two tiles from the ceiling and/or the floor within 8 hexes from you. At the end of the tick, those tiles are connected with an interdimensional portal until you close it with an instantaneous action. Cooldown of 10 ticks.
Both tiles chosen are on the floor: entering a portal makes you appear in the tile adjacent to the second portal following the same direction you approached the first.
One tile is on the floor and the other on the ceiling: entering a portal on the floor makes you fall from the ceiling taking 2 damage and spending the next tick stunned. A loop is definitely an option.
Both tiles chosen are on the ceiling: Nonsense! Unless you can fly or revert gravity… then look at the first case.
misc.note: First you will be baked, and then there will be cake.
